shopping.name: Zhongyang Street (中央大街)
shopping.notes: Historic Russian-style street. Shop for: Russian souvenirs (Matryoshka dolls, amber jewelry), winter gear (fur hats, scarves), local snacks (Harbin red sausage). Most shops open 9am-9pm. Bargaining possible in small shops but not in branded stores.

shopping.name: Harbin Souvenir Shop (尔滨之恋冰箱贴纪念品)
shopping.notes: Specializes in Harbin-themed magnets, postcards, and small gifts. Good for affordable mementos. Price range: 10-50 RMB per item. Cash and WeChat Pay accepted.

shopping.name: Ancient Culture Street (古文化街)
shopping.location: Ancient Culture Street, Nankai District, Tianjin
shopping.notes: UNESCO-recognized street for traditional Chinese crafts. Shop for: Clay figurines (泥人张), paper cuts, traditional paintings, Chinese knots, vintage items. Open 9am-6pm. Bargaining expected (start at 50-60% of asking price). Avoid overpriced 'antiques' - most are reproductions.

shopping.name: Ancient Culture Market (古文化市场)
shopping.notes: Indoor market with multiple vendors selling calligraphy, seals, tea sets, and folk art. More concentrated selection than the street. Prices: 20-500 RMB depending on item. Best for authentic local crafts.

shopping.name: Muslim Quarter (回民街)
shopping.notes: Famous food street with shops selling terracotta warrior replicas, local snacks, Islamic crafts. Shop for: Mini terracotta warriors (20-200 RMB), shadow puppets, Chinese painting scrolls. Open late into evening (6am-11pm). Heavily touristy - check quality before buying. Terracotta replicas: buy from established shops, not street vendors.

shopping.name: Tang Dynasty Ever-Bright City (大唐不夜城)
shopping.location: South of Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, Xi'an
shopping.notes: Modern cultural complex with Tang Dynasty theme. Shop for: Tang-style cultural products, silk scarves, artisan tea sets, cultural creative products. Open 10am-10pm (night market extends to 11pm). Higher quality but also higher prices than Muslim Quarter. Good for: gift-worthy items, modern interpretations of traditional crafts.

shopping.name: Pingjiang Road Ancient Street (平江路古街)
shopping.notes: Canal-side historic street with boutique shops. Shop for: Suzhou embroidery, silk products, traditional fans, local snacks. Open 9am-9pm. Less touristy than Shantang Street. Silk items: 100-500 RMB for quality pieces. Look for 'Suzhou Silk Museum' certification for authentic silk.

shopping.name: Suzhou Silk Museum Shop
shopping.notes: Official museum shop with certified authentic Suzhou silk products. Shop for: Silk scarves (150-800 RMB), silk bedding, traditional embroidery. Open 9am-5pm (closed Mondays). Higher prices but guaranteed quality and authenticity. Good for serious silk purchases. Tax-free shopping available for tourists.

shopping.name: Longjing Tea Village (龙井村)
shopping.location: Longjing Village, West Lake Scenic Area, Hangzhou
shopping.notes: Famous for authentic West Lake Longjing tea. Shop for: Longjing green tea (200-2000 RMB/500g depending on grade). Visit family-run tea houses for tea tasting before buying. Spring harvest (pre-Qingming) is most expensive and best quality. Avoid street vendors - buy from established tea houses with licenses. Ask for vacuum-sealed packaging. Average good quality: 400-600 RMB/500g.

shopping.name: Hefang Street (河坊街)
shopping.notes: Traditional shopping street near West Lake. Shop for: Hangzhou silk products, tea sets, chopsticks, fans, local snacks (walnut cake, osmanthus candy). Open 9am-10pm. Mix of tourist shops and local businesses. Longjing tea also available but more touristy than village. Bargaining acceptable in small shops.

shopping.name: West Street (阳朔西街)
shopping.notes: Main shopping street in Yangshuo. Shop for: Minority handicrafts, batik cloth, stone carvings, tea, local snacks. Open 9am-late. Very touristy - bargain hard (start at 40% of asking price). Quality varies greatly. Best for: casual souvenirs, not high-value items.

shopping.name: Guilin Specialty Shops (桂林特产伴手礼)
shopping.notes: Chain store selling Guilin specialties. Shop for: Osmanthus candy, chili sauce, Guilin rice noodle sauce, dried fruits, tea. Fixed prices (no bargaining). Open 9am-10pm. Good for: packaged gifts, food products. Price range: 20-150 RMB per item. Vacuum-packed for travel.

shopping.name: Zhangjiajie Specialty Stores
shopping.notes: Multiple specialty stores in city center. Shop for: Tujia brocade (土家织锦), Zhangjiajie tea, preserved wild vegetables, dried mushrooms, local honey. Open 9am-9pm. Recommended stores: 湘品汇特产超市 (Xiangpinhui) - fixed prices, quality products. Avoid: shops with aggressive touts near tourist sites. Price range: 30-200 RMB per item.

shopping.name: Beijing Road Pedestrian Street (北京路步行街)
shopping.notes: Major shopping street with mix of local and international brands. Shop for: Cantonese herbal products, tea, dried seafood, fashion. Open 10am-10pm. Modern shopping experience with department stores and boutiques. Good for: mainstream shopping, not traditional crafts. Price range varies from budget to luxury.

shopping.name: Shamian Island Shops
shopping.notes: Historic colonial island with boutique shops and cafes. Shop for: Artisan coffee, small crafts, postcards. More atmosphere than shopping variety. Good for: leisurely browsing, not major purchases. Open 10am-8pm.

shopping.name: Dongmen Pedestrian Street (东门老街)
shopping.notes: Budget shopping area popular with locals. Shop for: Electronics, fashion, accessories. Open 10am-10pm. Bargaining possible in small shops. More affordable than Hong Kong. Watch for knockoffs - check quality carefully. Good for: budget fashion finds, electronic accessories.

shopping.name: Temple Street Night Market (庙街夜市)
shopping.location: Temple Street, Yau Ma Tei, Kowloon, Hong Kong
shopping.notes: Famous night market. Shop for: Souvenirs, cheap electronics, clothing, jade jewelry. Opens 6pm-midnight. Heavy bargaining culture (start at 40% of asking price). Watch for fake goods. Good for: Hong Kong memorabilia, casual souvenirs. Atmosphere is part of the experience.

shopping.name: Harbour City
shopping.location: Canton Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong
shopping.notes: One of Hong Kong's largest luxury malls. Shop for: International designer brands, watches, cosmetics. Open 10am-10pm. Fixed prices (no bargaining). Good for: duty-free luxury shopping, high-end purchases. Price range: luxury tier. Tax benefits compared to mainland China.

shopping.name: Senado Square (议事亭前地)
shopping.notes: Historic square surrounded by shops. Shop for: Portuguese egg tarts, almond cookies, Portuguese wine, Portuguese imported goods, Macau souvenirs. Famous bakeries: Koi Kei (钜记), Lord Stow's (安德鲁). Open 10am-10pm. Fixed prices in major stores. Good for: Macau food gifts, Portuguese products. Buy egg tarts fresh (don't transport long distances).

shopping.name: The Venetian Macao Shops
shopping.location: Estrada da Baia de Nossa Senhora da Esperanca, Macau
shopping.notes: Luxury resort shopping mall. Shop for: International brands, jewelry, cosmetics, Portuguese wine. Open 10am-11pm. Indoor 'Venice' canals theme. Fixed prices. Good for: luxury shopping, browsing. Higher-end than street shops. Duty-free advantages.

notes: Shopping budget recommendations are per location/area, not per item. Budget allocation: Days 1-10 (China domestic): focus on local specialties and crafts (30-80 USD/day). Days 11-13 (Guangzhou-Hong Kong-Macau): higher budget for luxury shopping if interested (100-200 USD/day). Currency: 1 USD = ~7.2 RMB. Payment: WeChat Pay/Alipay widely accepted in mainland China; cash/credit cards better in Hong Kong/Macau. Bargaining culture: Expected in markets and small shops (start 40-60% of asking price), not in malls or established stores. Quality check: For silk, tea, and jade, buy from established shops with certifications to avoid fakes. Luggage: Consider shipping purchases if buying heavy items (tea, ceramics) - many shops offer international shipping. Customs: Check airline baggage limits. No restrictions on tea, silk, or crafts for personal use. Avoid antiques (require special permits). Shopping timing: Don't schedule heavy shopping on travel days. Best shopping days: Days 3 (Tianjin), 6 (Suzhou silk), 7 (Hangzhou tea), 13 (Macau food gifts).
